title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 §§ 635-16.3 - Eligibility Requirements for Individuals to be Enrolled in CSIDD
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 §§ 635-16.3 - Eligibility Requirements for Individuals to be Enrolled in CSIDD
State Regulations
(a) Eligibility for
CSIDD must be determined by the Developmental Disabilities Regional Offices
(DDRO) prior to the provision of services. (b) Individuals may be eligible for
enrollment in CSIDD, if they: (1)
are
enrolled in Medicaid; (2)
are six
(6) years of age or older; and
(3)
meet the Medical Necessity Criteria, which includes having: (i) established eligibility for OPWDD
services; and
(ii)
significant
behavioral and/or mental health needs. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14
§§
635-16.3

Adopted

New

York State Register January 6, 2021/Volume XLIII, Issue 01, eff. 1/6/2021

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
